definition: The middle layer of the wall of a blood vessel or lymph vessel which is composed of connective and muscular tissue.
A dwelling.
A number of things that follow on one after the other or are connected one after the other.
A play, dance, or other entertainment.
A series of sounds organized in time, employing melody, harmony, tempo etc. usually to convey a mood.
A thin layer of some substance; a pellicle; a membranous covering, causing opacity.

The conscious production or arrangement of sounds, colours, forms, movements, or other elements in a manner that affects the senses and emotions, usually specifically the production of the beautiful in a graphic or plastic medium.
An electronic communication medium that allows the transmission of real-time visual images, and often sound.
A playful or competitive activity.
The arts, customs, lifestyles, background, and habits that characterize a particular society or nation.
A playful or competitive activity.
Someone who lives in modern times.
Television, television show, movie.
A kind; a stylistic category or sort, especially of literature or other artworks.
A thin layer of some substance; a pellicle; a membranous covering, causing opacity.
An artist’s or photographer’s workshop or the room in which an artist works.
A play, dance, or other entertainment.
Heroin.
The body of all written works.
A recorded sequence of images displayed on a screen at a rate sufficiently fast to create the appearance of motion.

An activity designed to give pleasure, enjoyment, diversion, amusement, or relaxation to an audience, no matter whether the audience participates passively as in watching opera or a movie, or actively as in games.
A composition, normally in prose, telling a story and intended to be represented by actors impersonating the characters and speaking the dialogue
A place or building, consisting of a stage and seating, in which an audience gathers to watch plays, musical performances, public ceremonies, and so on.
A solid, more or less rigid object of metal or wood with a uniform cross-section smaller than its length.
A transmission of a radio or television programme intended to be received by anyone with a receiver.
(Westminster system) The head of government in parliament and leader of the cabinet.
A film, TV program, publication etc. which presents a social, political, scientific or historical subject in a factual or informative manner.
The art, process, or job of filming movies.
A photograph.
A movie theatre, a movie house
A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance, speech, etc.
A place or building, consisting of a stage and seating, in which an audience gathers to watch plays, musical performances, public ceremonies, and so on.
Agreement in a design or plan; union formed by mutual communication of opinions and views; accordance in a scheme; harmony; simultaneous action.
A recorded sequence of images displayed on a screen at a rate sufficiently fast to create the appearance of motion.
The act of producing, making or creating something.
A narrow strip running down a movie film that carries the recorded sound in synchronization with the pictures.
The art and technology of producing images on photosensitive surfaces, and its digital counterpart.
An eating establishment in which diners are served food, usually by waiters at their tables but sometimes (as in a fast food restaurant) at a counter.
A stage performance, especially one by amateurs.
A rebirth or revival.
To visit stores or shops to browse or explore merchandise, especially with the intention of buying such merchandise.
The act of animating, or giving life or spirit.
A public house where beverages, primarily alcoholic, may be bought and consumed, also providing food and sometimes entertainment such as live music or television.
A beverage made by infusing the beans of the coffee plant in hot water.
An independent publisher.
To roll or throw (a ball) in the correct manner in cricket and similar games and sports.
Something that thrills.
A producer or director of films/movies.
A pedestrianised street, especially a shopping precinct.

To gamble.

To flow in a continuous or steady manner, like a liquid.

A producer or director of films/movies.
A cut scene.
A stage performance, show or film that involves singing, dancing and musical numbers performed by the cast as well as acting.
Fiction in which advanced technology or science is a key element.
A company of, often touring, actors, singers or dancers.
The activity of preparing edited video works, formerly principally films, whether for entertainment or other purposes.
A building or a place where several activities occur in multiple units concurrently or different times.
A flash of lightning accompanied by a crash of thunder.

A building where movies are shown to an audience; a cinema.
A snack food made from corn/maize kernels popped by dry heating.

A machine outfitted with sharp blades, for mashing, crushing or liquefying food ingredients.
Any of a variety of thermoplastics created from nitrocellulose and camphor, once used as photographic film.
A building where movies are shown to an audience; a cinema.
A camera that could develop its own film and served as its own projector.
A person who operates a film projector, especially one who does so as an occupation at a movie theatre or drive-in theatre.
An early form of movie projector
A person who makes movies as a profession; a cinematographer
An elaborately decorated motion picture theater, principally constructed from 1910 to 1950.
